verses.verse: And there was a famine<WH7458> in the land,<WH776> beside<WH905> the first<WH7223> famine<WH7458> that was in the days<WH3117> of Abraham.<WH85> And Isaac<WH3327> went<WH3212> to Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428> of the Philistines<WH6430> to Gerar.<WH1642>
And the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> to him, and said,<WH559> Go<WH3381> not down<WH3381> into Egypt;<WH4714> dwell<WH7931> in the land<WH776> which<WH834> I shall tell<WH559> you of:

Sojourn<WH1481> in this<WH2063> land,<WH776> and I will be with you, and will bless<WH1288> you; for to you, and to your seed,<WH2233> I will give<WH5414> all<WH3605> these<WH411> countries,<WH776> and I will perform<WH6965> the oath<WH7621> which<WH834> I swore<WH7650> to Abraham<WH85> your father;<WH1>

And I will make your seed<WH2233> to multiply<WH7235> as the stars<WH3556> of heaven,<WH8064> and will give<WH5414> to your seed<WH2233> all<WH3605> these<WH411> countries;<WH776> and in your seed<WH2233> shall all<WH3605> the nations<WH1471> of the earth<WH776> be blessed;<WH1288>
Because<WH6118> that Abraham<WH85> obeyed<WH8085> my voice,<WH6963> and kept<WH8104> my charge,<WH4931> my commandments,<WH4687> my statutes,<WH2708> and my laws.<WH8451>
And Isaac<WH3327> dwelled<WH3427> in Gerar:<WH1642>

And the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> asked<WH7592> him of his wife;<WH802> and he said,<WH559> She is my sister:<WH269> for he feared<WH3372> to say,<WH559> She is my wife;<WH802> lest,<WH6435> said<WH559> he, the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> should kill<WH2026> me for Rebekah;<WH7259> because<WH3588> she was fair<WH2896> to look<WH4758> on.

And it came<WH1961> to pass, when<WH3588> he had been there<WH8033> a long<WH748> time,<WH3117> that Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428> of the Philistines<WH6430> looked<WH8259> out at<WH1157> a window,<WH2474> and saw,<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> Isaac<WH3327> was sporting<WH6711> with Rebekah<WH7259> his wife.<WH802>

And Abimelech<WH40> called<WH7121> Isaac,<WH3327> and said,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> of a surety<WH389> she is your wife;<WH802> and how<WH349> said<WH559> you, She is my sister?<WH269> And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> to him, Because<WH3588> I said,<WH559> Lest<WH6435> I die<WH4191> for her.

And Abimelech<WH40> said,<WH559> What<WH4100> is this<WH2063> you have done<WH6213> to us? one<WH259> of the people<WH5971> might lightly<WH4592> have lien<WH7901> with your wife,<WH802> and you should have brought<WH935> guiltiness<WH817> on us.
And Abimelech<WH40> charged<WH6680> all<WH3605> his people,<WH5971> saying,<WH559> He that touches<WH5060> this<WH2088> man<WH376> or his wife<WH802> shall surely be put to death.<WH4191>
Then Isaac<WH3327> sowed<WH2232> in that land,<WH776> and received<WH4672> in the same<WH1931> year<WH8141> an hundred times:<WH3967> <WH8180> and the LORD<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> him.
And the man<WH376> waxed great,<WH1431> and went<WH3212> forward,<WH1980> and grew<WH1432> until<WH5704> he became<WH1431> very<WH3966> great:<WH1431>
For he had possession<WH4735> of flocks,<WH6629> and possession<WH4735> of herds,<WH1241> and great<WH7227> store of servants:<WH5657> and the Philistines<WH6430> envied<WH7065> him.

For all<WH3605> the wells<WH875> which<WH834> his father's<WH1> servants<WH5650> had dig<WH2658> in the days<WH3117> of Abraham<WH85> his father,<WH1> the Philistines<WH6430> had stopped<WH5640> them, and filled<WH4390> them with earth.<WH6083>
And Abimelech<WH40> said<WH559> to Isaac,<WH3327> Go<WH3212> from us; for you are much<WH3966> mightier<WH6105> than we.
And Isaac<WH3327> departed<WH3212> there,<WH8033> and pitched<WH2583> his tent in the valley<WH5158> of Gerar,<WH1642> and dwelled<WH3427> there.<WH8033>

And Isaac<WH3327> dig<WH2658> again<WH7725> the wells<WH875> of water,<WH4325> which<WH834> they had dig<WH2658> in the days<WH3117> of Abraham<WH85> his father;<WH1> for the Philistines<WH6430> had stopped<WH5640> them after<WH310> the death<WH4194> of Abraham:<WH85> and he called<WH7121> their names<WH8034> after the names<WH8034> by which<WH834> his father<WH1> had called<WH7121> them.
And Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> dig<WH2658> in the valley,<WH5158> and found<WH4672> there<WH8033> a well<WH875> of springing<WH2416> water.<WH4325>

And the herdsmen<WH7462> of Gerar<WH1642> did strive<WH7378> with Isaac's<WH3327> herdsmen,<WH7462> saying,<WH559> The water<WH4325> is ours: and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the well<WH875> Esek;<WH6230> because<WH3588> they strove<WH6229> with him.
And they dig<WH2658> another<WH312> well,<WH875> and strove<WH7378> for that also:<WH1571> and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of it Sitnah.<WH7856>

And he removed<WH6275> from there,<WH8033> and dig<WH2658> another<WH312> well;<WH875> and for that they strove<WH7378> not: and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of it Rehoboth;<WH7344> and he said,<WH559> For now<WH6258> the LORD<WH3068> has made room<WH7337> for us, and we shall be fruitful<WH6509> in the land.<WH776>
And he went<WH5927> up from there<WH8033> to Beersheba.<WH884>

And the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> to him the same<WH1931> night,<WH3915> and said,<WH559> I am the God<WH430> of Abraham<WH85> your father:<WH1> fear<WH3372> not, for I am with you, and will bless<WH1288> you, and multiply<WH7235> your seed<WH2233> for my servant<WH5650> Abraham's<WH85> sake.<WH5668>

And he built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there,<WH8033> and called<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of the LORD,<WH3068> and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> there:<WH8033> and there<WH8033> Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> dig<WH3738> a well.<WH875>
Then Abimelech<WH40> went<WH1980> to him from Gerar,<WH1642> and Ahuzzath<WH276> one of his friends,<WH4828> and Phichol<WH6369> the chief captain<WH8269> of his army.<WH6635>
And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> to them, Why<WH4069> come<WH935> you to me, seeing you hate<WH8130> me, and have sent<WH7971> me away from you?

And they said,<WH559> We saw<WH7200> certainly that the LORD<WH3068> was with you: and we said,<WH559> Let there be now<WH4994> an oath<WH423> between<WH996> us, even between<WH996> us and you, and let us make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with you;

That you will do<WH6213> us no<WH3808> hurt,<WH7451> as we have not touched<WH5060> you, and as we have done<WH6213> to you nothing<WH7535> but good,<WH2896> and have sent<WH7971> you away in peace:<WH7965> you are now<WH6258> the blessed<WH1288> of the LORD.<WH3068>
And he made<WH6213> them a feast,<WH4960> and they did eat<WH398> and drink.<WH8354>

And they rose<WH7925> up betimes<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> and swore<WH7650> one<WH376> to another:<WH251> and Isaac<WH3327> sent<WH7971> them away, and they departed<WH3212> from him in peace.<WH7965>

And it came<WH1961> to pass the same day,<WH3117> that Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> came,<WH935> and told<WH5608> him concerning<WH5921> <WH182> the well<WH875> which<WH834> they had dig,<WH2658> and said<WH559> to him, We have found<WH4672> water.<WH4325>
And he called<WH7121> it Shebah:<WH7656> therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the name<WH8034> of the city<WH5892> is Beersheba<WH884> to this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>

And Esau<WH6215> was forty<WH705> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he took<WH3947> to wife<WH802> Judith<WH3067> the daughter<WH1323> of Beeri<WH882> the Hittite,<WH2850> and Bashemath<WH1315> the daughter<WH1323> of Elon<WH356> the Hittite:<WH2850>
Which were a grief<WH4786> of mind<WH7307> to Isaac<WH3327> and to Rebekah.<WH7259>
